channel.title: Star Wars Saturday (Legends): - Hutt Cartel
channel.description:
**Star Wars Saturday (Legends): - Hutt Cartel**
March Saturday afternoons (1500 GMT) I'll be running this Star Wars reskin of Cartel, set in the criminal underbelly of the Coruscant underworld.
(S1)March 6 - https://gauntletcalendar.com/event-detail/-MQ9RoZXZdRPz5KU2CvD (S2) March 13 - https://gauntletcalendar.com/event-detail/-MQ9TEPzQ0orJXk4UGW3 (S3) March 20 - https://gauntletcalendar.com/event-detail/-MQ9TMwFwQjVx7sT3B60 (S4) March 27 -https://gauntletcalendar.com/event-detail/-MQ9TcrLOdZI67u3jZXp
Expect murder, poverty, betrayal and all sorts of dark sithspit. 18 rated Star Wars (but classy).

item.title: Star Wars Saturday (Legends): - Hutt Cartel
item.dc:creator: @Paul_T
item.description:
@Paul_T wrote:

That sounds like a good time! Thank you for spelling all that out; I’m actually tempted to give it a try myself sometime. I might try it in a less “urban” environment (like Mos Eisley or something), but I think it’s a good match of system to setting, and it would be fun to see how it changes the feel of the gameplay.

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Saturday (Legends): - Hutt Cartel
item.dc:creator: @Will_H
item.description:
@Will_H wrote:

Hmmm… I can see that Magpie have taken the Cartel ashcan down and only have the full book up on DriveThru, so don’t want to share their IP.

It really is just a reskin of all the moves and books, the slang etc. Politza = Security Officer/ISB officer (you choose), El Narco = The Crimelord, etc. Guns = Blasters. I think the biggest change is to some of the Sicario (Assassin) weapons are ‘Ion gun’ or ‘Vibrosword’ and the tags have changed. Oh and all the drugs are star wars drugs Strangely I think that Hutt Cartel actually makes the Cocinero playbook easier to fit in with the other characters, though La Espoza feels less in place (Star Wars has less of a ‘normal’ civilian world to maintain).There’s no Force users and though you can play any SW species, no one has alien powers (Wookie super strength or what have you) or stat changes due to that.

The Plaza of Durango is now Level 1313 of Coruscant and often scenes may take you up-level to the Surface rather than wholly taking place within ‘The Plaza’. But COruscant is a planet wide city so it’s easy to handwave the interconnectedness. In my last session I ran for GCOG I introduced some Rebellion contacts and a heavy handed Imperial lockdown, which given the tangled history of the drug trade and military/espionage involvement felt like it fit perfectly well with the game.

This will be my first attempt at running Cartel of any kind more than one session! Major obstacle is remembering to say Star Wars curse words rather than ****.

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Saturday (Legends): - Hutt Cartel
item.dc:creator: @Paul_T
item.description:
@Paul_T wrote:

Very nice! Would you consider sharing a link to the keeper? (Or tell us more about it here?)

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Saturday (Legends): - Hutt Cartel
item.dc:creator: @Will_H
item.description:
@Will_H wrote:

There’s a character keeper with some things reskinned and some other notes, but it’s so 1:1 alot of it is on the fly. Works really well I think. It’s definitely a darker hive of scum and villainy than any we’ve seen on the screen.

Read full topic

item.title: Star Wars Saturday (Legends): - Hutt Cartel
item.dc:creator: @Paul_T
item.description:
@Paul_T wrote:

I’m curious! Is the reskin being done “on the fly”, or is there an actual document or source for this?

(Both have their advantages and disadvantages, of course.)

Read full topic
